Text: I'm on a crap 256k up line so please bear with me........i'll seed as long as I can, but i'd appreciate help seeding this upload too.

lol

Cool, that 's the AOPA members freebie with the glass cockpit.  This from Avsim below.  Aren't we all charter members of the AOPA?

AOPA = Association of the Pirates of America

Free to AOPA members, the virtual Cherokee Six duplicates nearly every detail of the sweepstakes airplane, including the S-Tec System Fifty-Five X autopilot ? which includes S-Tec's flight director and altitude preselector ? the Sandel SN-3500 electronic horizontal situation indicator, Garmin GNS 530/GNS 430 navigators, Avidyne FlightMax EX500 multifunction display, and JP Instruments EDM-930 engine gauge cluster.

The program, developed by Flight1 Software in conjunction with AOPA, requires a personal 
computer running Windows XP and Microsoft Flight Simulator 2004.

Works with FSX? 

Thanks and lol to the joke.

REQ: Eaglesoft's Columbia 400

I've looked at it on the ground now, it's a great cockpit and very user friendly and intuitive with excellent documentation.  A bit tough on FPS but to be expected with all the goodies.  

Very nice overall and I love the Cherokee 6.

Another 100 pages to read now, sure glad I saved that old computer.
awesome, love those Flight1/AOPA planes

Just tested in FSX and I  can confirm its 95/99% compatible.....only problem that I saw was that one of the "glass" instrument gauges failed to show up in vc mode.The other Garmin/Sandel gauges appear to work fine !!!
There's supposed to be an FSX fix out any moment now and it should make it on here.  I'm liking this aircraft more and more by the moment.  It's like a 57 Chevy with space shuttle systems, very cool.

Thnx for the upload!!Just made a little testflight and everything work A-O-K :).this thing really has everything on board!Even a DVD player!!lol
Would love to take a ride in one off these birds once...

Thnx again for the upload GeeTI!!
heavy on them frames per second but thank you.
